result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Continue with AODA treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

defendant.name: Peterson Kamp, Samuel J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 5 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court addresses WCS letter. State does not rquest to address the report. Statements presented by Atty. Bricco.  Court does not take action as to the non compliance letter from WCS.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Preliminary hearing on June 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day.

Defendant Samuel J Peterson Kamp in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
